articles.headline: U.S. Women on the Rise as Family Breadwinner
articles.snippet: Four in 10 households with children under age 18 now have a mother who is the sole or primary support.
articles.abstract: Four in 10 households with children under age 18 now have a mother who is the sole or primary support.
articles.lead_paragraph: Women are not only more likely to be the primary caregivers in a family. Increasingly, they are primary breadwinners, too.

articles.headline: New Flickr: Vast Space for Storage, at No Cost
articles.snippet: After years of falling short, Flickr was reborn last week. And every free account holder gets one terabyte of storage, a vast amount of space.
articles.abstract: After years of falling short, Flickr was reborn last week. And every free account holder gets one terabyte of storage, a vast amount of space.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you ever want to see just how much whining a million Interneters can produce, try giving them something wonderful at no charge.

articles.headline: Voters Speak, and Amazon Orders Shows
articles.snippet: The company says it used customer feedback in choosing five shows for its Amazon Prime service.
articles.abstract: The company says it used customer feedback in choosing five shows for its Amazon Prime service.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amazon, which has put its foray into original television programming up to a democratic vote, has ordered five series that will be offered on Amazon Prime, the company’s subscription service.

articles.headline: Former Bush Official Said to Be Obama Pick to Lead F.B.I.
articles.snippet: James B. Comey earned a reputation for independence after leading an internal revolt in the administration of George W. Bush over the legality of its warrantless wiretapping program.
articles.abstract: James B. Comey earned a reputation for independence after leading an internal revolt in the administration of George W. Bush over the legality of its warrantless wiretapping program.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama plans to nominate James B. Comey, a former hedge fund executive who served as a senior Justice Department official under President George W. Bush, to replace Robert S. Mueller III as the director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, according to two people with knowledge of the selection.

articles.headline: Documents Show Obama Officials in Tension Over British Banks
articles.snippet: HSBC and Standard Chartered were fined for funneling illicit money, rather than indicted.
articles.abstract: HSBC and Standard Chartered were fined for funneling illicit money, rather than indicted.
articles.lead_paragraph: Government documents have recently emerged that offer a rare behind-the-scenes glimpse into the Obama administration’s decision-making as it prepared to take actions against two big British banks.

articles.headline: Sallie Mae Will Split Old Loans From New
articles.snippet: The student lender will split into a loan-management company and a commercial bank offering a variety of services.
articles.abstract: The student lender will split into a loan-management company and a commercial bank offering a variety of services.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s largest private student lender, Sallie Mae, is cleaving itself into two companies — a move that will create a new home for more than $100 billion of student loans amid broad concerns from federal authorities and consumer advocates that graduates hobbled by debt are increasingly falling behind on their payments.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Catherine Rampell

articles.headline: China’s Food Deal Extends Its Reach, Already Mighty
articles.snippet: A Chinese takeover of a large American pork producer has prompted concern about China’s expanding role in the American food supply and the implications that might have for food safety.
articles.abstract: A Chinese takeover of a large American pork producer has prompted concern about China’s expanding role in the American food supply and the implications that might have for food safety.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you dined on tilapia recently, chances are it came from China. And that artificial vanilla you just used to make cookies? It, too, may have made the same long journey to your kitchen in the United States.

articles.headline: Anonymous Payment Schemes Thriving on Web
articles.snippet: Experts say there are hundreds of Internet payment systems that do not require users to identify themselves, making it difficult to seize on money laundering operations.
articles.abstract: Experts say there are hundreds of Internet payment systems that do not require users to identify themselves, making it difficult to seize on money laundering operations.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Eight years ago, Ernie Allen, the head of the International Center for Missing and Exploited Children, called the heads of major banks and credit card companies. Why, he wanted to know, were they letting child pornographers move illicit profits through their systems?
